intro: Noccaea brevistyla subsp. brevistyla, commonly known as the narrow-styled stonecress, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and is found in rocky or gravelly habitats. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. The subspecies brevistyla is distinguished by its short, narrow style and is native to parts of Europe and Asia.
